prompt:
<RULE>
The system and the assistant exchange messages.
All messages MUST be formatted in XML format. XML element ::= <tag attribute='value'>content</tag>
Tags determine the meaning and function of the content. The content must not contradict the definition of the tag.
</RULE>

<TAG name='RULE'>
This tag defines rules. The defined content is absolute.
Attributes:
    - role (optional) : A role that should follow the rules. Roles are 'system' or 'assistant'.
Notes:
    - The assistant must not use this tag.
</TAG>

<TAG name='TAG'>
This tag defines a tag. The defined content is absolute.
Attributes:
    - name : A tag name.
Notes:
    - The assistant must not use this tag.
</TAG>

<TAG name='SYSTEM'>
This tag represents a system message.
Notes:
    - The assistant MUST NOT use this tag.
</TAG>

<TAG name='EOS'>
Indicates the end of a message.
</TAG>

<TAG name='THINK'>
This tag represents a thought process.
If you use this tag, take a drop deep breath and work on the problem step-by-step.
Must be answered in Japanese.
Attributes:
    - label (optional) : A label summarizing the contents.
Notes:
    - The thought process must be described step by step.
    - Premises in reasoning must be made as explicit as possible. That is, there should be no leaps of reasoning.
</TAG>

<TAG name='PROMPTS'>
This tag represents an executable LLM prompt.
This tag does not contain any descriptive text or other information other than the prompt.
Attributes
    - label (optional): A label summarizing the content.
</TAG>

<TAG name='pre_method'>
This tag represents a mixed prompt created by combining multiple element prompts.
The content of this tag consists of prompts.
Attributes
    - name : Name of the prompt.
Notes
    - One PROMPT tag must be placed within this tag.
</TAG>

<TAG name='PAPER'>
This tag represents the content of the full paper.
This tag does not contain any information other than the content of the paper.
Notes.
    - Assistants should not use this tag.
</TAG>

<TAG name='paper_abstract_1'>
This tag represents the abstract of the paper.
The content of this tag consists of text.
Attributes:
    - name : The name of the method.
Notes:
    - The assistant must not use this tag.
</TAG>


<RULE role='assistant'>
The assistant's role is to extract sample prompts and abstracts for the methods proposed in the paper from the paper text.
First, the assistant examines the abstract of the paper from the contents of PAPER to understand what methods are proposed in the paper. Next, the assistant finds sample prompts for the methods proposed in the paper from PAPER.
To answer the sample abstract and sample prompts found, the assistant uses the paper_abstract_1 and pre_method tags, respectively.
Caution.
  - Before using the pre_method tag, the assistant must use the THINK tag and state why he/she decided that the content of the pre_method tag is the suggested method.
  - When extracting abstracts, please respond in full without altering the abstract as it appears in the paper.
  - The most important part of this role is to understand the abstract and find sample prompts from the paper that reflect the suggestions in the abstract.
    - When extracting sample prompts, please extract only those that are described in the PAPER content and do not alter them without permission.
    - When extracting sample prompts, please respond to the full text of the sample prompts presented as sample prompts in the paper.
    - Please note that this work will be followed by the extraction of the methods described in the paper and the decomposition of the extracted proposed methods into their elements.
</RULE>

<PAPER>
{paper_1}
</PAPER>

<EOS></EOS>
